item.title: Ben Sasse is exiting the stage far too soon
item.description: The former Republican senator from Nebraska announced last week he has Stage 4 pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Why West Africa is worth worrying about
item.description: Strikes on ISIS targets in Nigeria are welcome but insufficient.

item.title: Unfinished business in the Middle East
item.description: Lebanon’s army tries to disarm Hezbollah in the south, but Israel says it’s not moving fast enough.

item.title: Trump’s security promise to Ukraine may be more dangerous than it looks
item.description: An Article 5-style security guarantee to Ukraine may be more dangerous than it looks.

item.title: My best friend’s funeral changed the way I think about him
item.description: Secret war heroes, remembered by readers who knew them.

item.title: What’s next, the Trump Washington Monument?
item.description: The Kennedy Center, solar tax credits, fertility and parenting, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: Cartoon by Joe Heller
item.description: Joe Heller cartoon on New Year’s ball drop and health insurance premiums.

item.title: I perform at a piano bar. The most requested song might surprise you.
item.description: So long “Piano Man.” Chappell Roan’s ode to a gay bar now draws the most requests.

item.title: An electric car mandate crashes into reality
item.description: Failures by Ford and Europe on EVs are instructive.

item.title: As 2025 slinks offstage, at least that’s something to cheer about
item.description: Farewell to a year that brought the Cracker Barrel brouhaha, the DOGE dud and the Gulf of America.
